definition: example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Thisdocument is typically drafted and witnessed by an attorney.
sentences.chinese: 这种文件通常是草拟好的，并会由一位律师鉴证。

sentences.english: Article 3 The National Development and Reform Commission is the examination and approval organ for the registration of price assessors.
sentences.chinese: 第三条国家发展改革委为价格鉴证师的注册审批机关。

sentences.english: If you are not a subscriber, please register .
sentences.chinese: 经注册的价格鉴证师不需认定。

sentences.english: The company's strength to be your authentication.
sentences.chinese: 公司的实力有待您的鉴证。

sentences.english: Article 2 These Measures are applicable to the work relating to the registration and administration of price assessors.
sentences.chinese: 第二条价格鉴证师注册与管理工作，适用本办法。

sentences.english: This heigh-security feature can be verified using a magnifying glass or microscope.
sentences.chinese: 此高度防伪特征可于高倍放大镜或显微镜下鉴证。

definition: eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)/to sign off on sth
